title: Nato summit in Wales - EU to announce new sanctions against Russia â as it happened | Politics | The Guardian
summary: iraqi president asks nato to help it fight isis .
wales - castle capital of the world , says cameron .

documents.title: afternoon summary
text: the european union is expected to announce a new package of sanctions against russia on friday , british government sources have revealed .
peter maer ( @ petermaercbs ) white house says nato leaders condemn russian actions in # ukraine and agree on need for moscow `` to face increase costs '' for actions .

petro poroshenko , ukraine 's president , and the main pro-russian separatist leader in his country have both said they will order a ceasefire on friday , provided an agreement is reached on a new peace plan .
at the eu summit leaders have just started a meeting of the nato-ukraine commission .
it has been reported that nato will agree four trust funds for ukraine .

petro poroshenko and anders fogh rasmussen at the opening of the nato-ukraine commission meeting afghanistan 's two rival presidential candidates , ashraf ghani and abdullah abdullah , have sent a message to nato saying that they will do their utmost to reach a political agreement that would end a crisis over disputed elections .
rasmuussen urged them to do so .

he said : i can confirm that we received a message from the two presidential candidates indicating that they will do all they can to reach a political agreement and if that materialises we would warmly welcome it .
afghanistan deserves a rapid completion of the electoral process with an outcome that can be accepted by the afghan people .
nato leaders have agreed to maintain a long-term financial commitment to afghanistan to help to maintain its security .
the details are set out in the summit declaration on afghanistan .
according to my colleague spencer ackerman , this could be worth up to $ 70bn .
spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) nato communique reaffirms alliance intends to continue financially underwriting the afghan security forces until 2024 .
spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) so , using nato 's dubious $ 4bn/annual projection ( $ 6bn is considered more realistic , see : that 's $ 70 bn 2010-2024 .
nick clegg , the deputy prime minister , has said that air strikes alone will not defeat isis .
he was echoing a point made by david cameron in his sunday telegraph article last month .

philippa thomas ( @ philippabbc ) nick clegg tells # bbc the solution to # is ca n't come out of # pentagon or # mod alone - must be led by # iraq govt & regional allies # nato philippa thomas ( @ philippabbc ) uk dep pm nick clegg tells bbc `` air strikes on their own do n't work '' - need a wider regionally led fight against # is natosummituk david lammy , the former labour minister who was praised for his response to the london riots in 2011 which started in his tottenham constituency , has announced that he is to seek the labour nomination for london mayor in 2016 .
that 's all from me for today .
tomorrow i will be covering the final day of the summit on a new live blog .
thanks for the comments .

documents.title: nato demonstration
text: and this is what the press association has filed about the demonstration .
hundreds of protesters have joined a march in newport against the nato summit in wales .
around 500 people marched from the cenotaph in the city centre towards the celtic manor venue , where the world leaders are meeting .
along the three mile route many members of the public watched and took and videos on their mobile phones as the protesters walked past .
among the anti-nato campaigners were members of the socialist party , socialist worker party , stop the war coalition and the red block , a communist group , who were dressed in black wearing masks .
during the march , which was escorted by the police , many carried banners and signs objecting to the summit .
they shouted no to nato , no new wars and they say warfare , we say welfare .
one elderly bystander was restrained by two police officers as he shouted at the marchers : i fought for this country , go home .
the press association has snapped this .
the european union is expected to announce a new package of sanctions against russia tomorrow , british government sources said .
here is some aerial footage of the demonstration at the nato summit .
rt ( @ rt com ) ' # stopnato ' : aerial footage of protests in wales at # natosummituk

documents.title: iraqi president asks nato to help it fight isis
text: earlier anders fogh rasmussen , the nato secretary general , said that iraq had not submitted a formal request for help in its fight against isis .
in an interview with cnn , fuad masum , the iraqi president , has said that he would like to request such help .
( but he also concedes that a formal request has not been submitted to nato , and so it is not clear whether his demand is an official one , or a rhetorical one .
he says iraq has already asked states that are members of nato for help . )
christiane amanpour ( @ camanpour ) nato says no formal request for help from iraq yet ; iraqi pres .
appeals for aid in intv w/ me : he also told cnn a new iraqi government would be formed within the next few days .
christiane amanpour ( @ camanpour ) iraqi pres tells me new gov't will be declared in the next few days .
says it will include shiites , sunnis + '' all other components of iraq . ''
q : when will nato funds be available for ukraine ?
and do you want allies to do more to offer military support ?
rasmussen says nato is not involved in delivering military equipment .
equipment is possessed by national governments , and so those are decisions for individual countries .
there will be an announcement about funds for ukraine later , after a meeting with ukraine .
and that 's it .
the press conference is over .
q : will nato engage in combat missions if the security situation deteriorates in afghanistan ?
rasmussen says the training mission being deployed from next year is a non-combat mission .
nato thinks the afghans will be able to take care of their own security .
he says he can not announce the exact figures for the training mission .
rasmussen is now taking questions .
q : are you reaffirming the $ 4.1bn promised in chicago ?
rasmussen says he is confident nato will meet this goal .
he says he has seen a message from the two presidential candidates saying they will do all they can to reach an agreement .

documents.title: nato secretary general 's news conference
text: anders fogh rasmussen , the nato secretary general , is holding his new conference now .
he says the isaf mission will come to an end in afghanistan this year .
but nato will continue supporting afghanistan in three ways , he says .
first , nato will be ready to assist the afghan armed forces with training .
this can happen once the right legal framework is in place .
second , nato is making financial commitments to help the afghan forces .
he says nato urges the rest of the international community to stay engaged .
managing the money will require transparency , stability and openness .
we need to know how our money is being spent , he says .
third , nato has committed itself to an enduring partnership with afghanistan .
afghanistan today is a very different country from the one it was a decade ago .
most afghans do n't want to return to those dark days .
he says nato urges the two afghan candidates to deliver a solution acceptable to the afghan people .

herman van rompuy , the european council president , has urged afghanistan 's two presidential candidates to put the interests of the country first and redouble their efforts in forming an inclusive government of national unity .
the message coming from both candidates is encouraging .
you can read his statement here .
herman van rompuy ( @ euhvr ) read my full intervention on # afghanistan at # natosummituk
this is from my colleague spencer ackerman .
spencer ackerman ( @ attackerman ) nato communique reaffirms alliance intends to continue financially underwriting the afghan security forces until 2024 .
dalia grybauskaite , the president of lithuania , told the bbc that her country would be at risk from russian aggression if nato did not act to stop russia in ukraine .
i think that if russia is not stopped , or russia 's aggression is not stopped , in ukraine , then sooner or later we will be facing the aggressor near our borders , absolutely , literally .
dalia grybauskaite , president of lithuania news
anders fogh rasmussen , the nato secretary general , is due to hold a press briefing any minute now .
and here 's where the heads of state are having dinner tonight .
andy davies ( @ adavies4 ) scene outside cardiff castle , venue for heads of state dinner later .
no traffic .
eerily quiet .
# natosummituk it 's cardiff castle , one of the 640 that david cameron was on about earlier .
here are some more from the summit .
the family photo for participants at the summit .
/getty images the opening of the summit .
rousseau/afp/getty images
petro poroshenko , the ukrainian president , has also been talking about his peace plan on twitter .
ððµññð¾ ðð¾ñð¾ñðµð½ðºð¾ ( @ poroshenko ) the key element of my peace plan is a ceasefire .
hopefully , its implementation will start tomorrow .
# nato # natoforukraine and he said this about the french sale of two warships to russia , which has been put on hold .
ððµññð¾ ðð¾ñð¾ñðµð½ðºð¾ ( @ poroshenko ) i thanked french president franã§ois hollande for his decision to halt supply of amphibious assault ships mistral to russia .

at the summit petro poroshenko , the ukrainian president , said that he would order a ceasefire in the conflict in the east of his country on friday , provided that a planned meeting of representatives from russia , ukraine and the osce goes ahead in minsk .

he told reporters : at 1400 local time [ 1100 gmt on friday ] , provided the [ minsk ] meeting takes place , i will call on the general staff to set up a bilateral ceasefire and we hope that the implementation of the peace plan will begin tomorrow .

according to reuters , the leader of the pro-russian rebels , said the separatists would also order a ceasefire , from one hour later , provided that kiev 's representatives signed up to a peace plan at the minsk meeting .
ukranian president petro poroshenko with david cameron ( right ) macdiarmid/pool/epa
here 's some more evidence of the remarkably generous approach that gwent police seem to be taking towards today 's demonstrators .
andy davies ( @ adavies4 ) 'anyone want water ? '
police to protestors # nato it 's not like this when the met are policing a demo

documents.title: nato military covenant
text: and this is what david cameron said in his opening statement ( see 1.35pm ) about the nato version of the military covenant that is being agreed .
according to number 10 , this is an idea that cameron has been championing personally .
our courageous armed forces do not just serve in afghanistan , but in many countries around the world .
they work tirelessly to keep us safe .

and that is why it is so important to me personally today that we are signing a landmark declaration which encapsulates our respect and our commitment to our armed forces , and our determination to look after them , and crucially their families , whether on the battlefield or back at home .
it looks as if the hacks at the summit are n't very happy about the food .
jayelwes ( @ jayelwes ) it turns out that the nato summit `` food village '' is two burger vans .
foreign press pack members looking distraught .
mirrorjames ( @ mirrorjames ) â£ 8 for a sandwich at # nato summit .
at least dick turpin wore a mask .
david cameron may find that a bit worrying .
rule number one for anyone managing a large pack of journalists is always to make sure that they are well fed .
my colleague steve morris has sent me an update on what happened when the protest arrived at celtic manor .
between 500 and 700 people have marched on celtic manor to protest against nato - far fewer than organisers had hoped .
they got as far as a steel cordon set up by the police , some 500m from the gates of the summit venue , the celtic manor resort .
a handful of protestors have tried to break through the cordon but without success .
a few have hurled bottles of water - handed out by the police - and sticks over the barrier .
the vast majority , however , have simply chanted , sang an handed out leaflets .
demonstrators protesing against the nato summit plunkett/reuters

documents.title: wales - castle capital of the world , says cameron
text: caerphilly castle curi , jr. , mba/flickr here 's the exact quote from david cameron in his opening statement ( see 1.35pm ) about why wales is such a good place for a defence summit .
this is also the right place to discuss defence .

wales has more castles , medieval castles per head than anywhere else in the world , around 640 of them , and i hope that will be something you 'll get to visit while you 're in wales at this conference .
to his credit , he is trying to do his bit for the welsh tourist industry .
caernarvon castle photograph : /flickr

documents.title: lunchtime summary
text: here 's a summary of the key developments so far .

britain is to directly arm the kurdish forces fighting islamic state ( isis ) in the north of iraq and has dispatched a senior british military officer to advise the kurdish forces prior to what may be a larger nato-led package to train the kurdish fighters , it has emerged .
david cameron has said that he sees no legal objections to britain joining air strikes against isis in syria .
in a series of interviews , he insisted that he was not ruling out air strikes , but said that he would only intervene at the invitation of the iraqi government .
according to the bbc , tory whips have started consulting backbench conservative mps to ask whether they would support air strikes in iraq or in syria .
anders fogh rasmussen , the nato secretary general , has said that russia is attacking ukraine .
he used the phrase shortly before ukraine 's president petro poroshenko met cameron , barack obama and other leading nato figures before the formal start of the summit .
a nato military official said well over 1,000 russian troops were operating inside ukraine .
the officer told reporters .

we are still seeing several thousand russian combat troops on the ground inside ukraine , equipped with hundreds of tanks and armoured vehicles , so ( there is ) no substantial change in the disposition of russian forces inside ukraine .
around 20,000 russian troops remain close to the ukrainian border , the officer said .

separately , it has been reported that ukraine 's army is on heightened alert near the port of mariupol on the sea of azov near the russian border amid rumours that pro-russian rebels are advancing towards the city .
rasmussen has said that nato will offer georgia a cooperation package that is going to take it a step further towards becoming a member .

russia has said that it expects france to honour its commitment to supply it with two warships , despite a decision by paris on wednesday to hold off on delivery for now because of the ukraine crisis .
the russian industry minister denis manturov said russia assumes that the contract will be fulfilled according to the agreements .
cameron and obama have visited a school in newport , where the summit is being held .
my colleague steve morris sent me this most schools in newport are closed to try to cut down traffic on the roads around celtic manor .
however , mount pleasant remained open after school governor stephen bowen wrote off a hopeful letter to the american embassy asking if the president would care to visit .
he was as surprised as anyone when the white house agreed .
crowds , some waving american flags , lined the streets to catch a glimpse of the president arriving with british prime minister david cameron .
it 's not every day a world leader arrives in south wales , said ann lock , who had dug out a stars and stripes for the occasion .
i think it 's good for wales and good for newport .
daniel rees , five , had prepared a poster welcoming the president in english and welsh .
his grandfather , bryn lewis , said : newport has been struggling a bit economically .
this has all got to be good pr for the place .
it might give us all a little boost .
barack obama and david cameron at mount pleasant primary school in newport jones / pool/epa campaigners have been marching towards the summit venue to protest about the meeting taking place .
there are more details about the reasons for the demonstration on the cnd website .
cnd ( @ cnduk ) # notonato protest begins in # newport : marching on celtic manor where # natosummituk is being held .

( photo : @ twitterid4 ) marcus edwards ( @ c4marcus ) quite some banner just turned up at the newport protest against # natosummituk # c4news nick clegg has implicitly criticised those british media organisation ( like the guardian ) that have named the briton being held hostage by isis .

speaking on his call clegg phone-in , he said that the media was free to take its own decisions but that the government 's advice from security experts was unambiguous that revealing details about the captured individual was not in their interests .

my own view is that given the advice from security experts was completely unambiguous - not a moment 's hesitation - that it is better for the hostage , it is better from a security point of view , not to reveal the name the more you create publicity around who the individual is , the more you create the incentive for the hostage takers to take ever more extreme steps .
nick clegg has been taken to task over his free school meal policy by a caller claiming to be a nine-year old boy , who told the deputy prime minister the results were not very impressive .
ed miliband has described the snp 's vision for a fairer scotland after independence as a con , insisting that the only way to rid the country of tory policies was to vote no .
the nato leaders have now started the closed part of their first session .
the live feed has been turned off .
david cameron is making an opening statement at the summit .
he says there are of the brecon beacons around the summit venue .
that is where the british military train , he says , and it explains why they are so tough .
he also says wales is an appropriate venue for a defence summit because it has 640 castles .
he hopes delegates will get the chance to visit some of them .
he pays tribute to the work done by nato soliders in afghanistan .
and he says that at the summit nato leaders will be signing a declaration committing themselves to looking after members of the armed forces .
( it 's like a nato version of the military covenent , and it 's an idea that cameron has personally been championing . )
at the summit anders fogh rasmussen , the nato secretary general , is opening the first session now .
you can follow it on the live feed .
this session is about afghanistan .

documents.title: britain to supply arms to kurds to help fight against isis
text: britain is going to supply arms to the kurds .
my colleague patrick wintour , who is covering the nato summit , has just filed this .

britain is to directly arm the kurdish forces fighting in the north of iraq and has despatched a senior british military officer to advise the kurdish forces prior to what may be a larger nato led package to train the kurdish fighters , and provide advice on command and control .
britain has been transporting non-lethal military equipment and ammunition being sent by other countries notably albania , but has not itself sent lethal equipment .
on wednesday britain delievered 10 tonnes of body armour , helmets and equipment .
albanian ammunition is needed since the kurdish fighters have largely russian made hardware .
britain has been one of the last western countries to offer to arm the kurds with similar decisions already taken by italy , france , america , australia and some smaller countries .
british hesitation may have been in deference to the objections from turkey , but also reflect britain has been sending tornados on reconnaissance missions .

downing street also confirmed that lieutenant general sir simon mayall , the ministry of defence middle east envoy has been arrived to ibril ( house style ) to act as the direct representative of the prime minister in kurdistan .
it looks like i 've just missed the family photograph on the live feed .
after the nato summit family photograph
here 's more on the meeting that david cameron and other leaders had with the ukrainian president , petro poroshenko .
according to poroshenko 's press secretary ( whose tweet below i 've translated using google ) , the talks were due to last for half an hour , but went on for more than an hour .
svyatoslav tsegolko ( @ stsegolko ) ððµñðµð³ð¾ð²ð¾ñð¸ , ñð¾ ð¼ð°ð » ð¸ ññð¸ð²ð°ñð¸ ð¿ñð²ð³ð¾ð´ð¸ð½ð¸ ñð¾ð·ññð³ð½ñð » ð¸ññ ð½ð° ð¿ð¾ð½ð°ð´ ð³ð¾ð´ð¸ð½ñ .
ð£ ðºñð°ñð½ññðºðµ ð¿ð¸ñð°ð½ð½ñ ðºð » ññð¾ð²ðµ
this is from the reuters bureau chief in the uk .
guy faulconbridge ( @ guyreuters ) breaking news : nato military officer says russia has several thousand combat troops , hundreds of tanks and armored vehicles inside ukraine
this is from the globe and mail 's mark mackinnon .
mark mackinnon ( @ markmackinnon ) nato official tells me hmcs toronto to be among 14 nato and allied ships entering the black sea for exercises on sept. 6 .
these are from chuck hagel , the us defence secretary 's , twitter account .
u.s. dept of defense ( @ deptofdefense ) happening now : # secdef hagel arrives at @ twitterid and meets with uk mod , michael fallon .
# natosummituk u.s. dept of defense ( @ deptofdefense ) happening now : # secdef hagel meets with afghan mod bismillah khan mohammadi @ twitterid .
# natosummituk
here 's a short nato summit reading list david frum at the atlantic says president obama delivered the most important promise about european security in the post-cold war era in estonia yesterday .
just this past week , nato agreed to form a new very high-readiness brigade that could quickly deploy anywhere in eastern europe .
meanwhile , u.s.-led sanctions are exerting an ever-tightening grip on the russian economy .

earlier this week , one gas-industry insider told the financial times that without access to u.s. technology , russia 's hopes to develop a liquefied natural-gas industry would be squashed like a bug .
that all sent a message , but only indirectly .
thedirect message came on wednesday , in tallinn , estonia , in the sharpest language any u.s. president has used toward russia since ronald reagan upbraided the evil empire .

one by one , president obama repudiated the lies vladimir putin has told about ukraine : that the ukrainians somehow provoked the invasion , that they are nazis , that their freely elected government is somehow illegal .
he rejected russia 's claim that it has some sphere of influence in ukraine , some right of veto over ukrainian constitutional arrangements .
and he forcefully assured estoniansand all nato 's new alliesthat waging war on them meant waging war on the united states .
[ t ] he defense of tallinn and riga and vilnius is just as important as the defense of berlin and paris and london , obama said .
article 5 is crystal clear .
an attack on one is an attack on all .

so if , in such a moment , you ever ask again , who 'll come to help , you 'll know the answer : the nato alliance , including the armed forces of the united states of america , right here , present , now in tallinn , president obama gave the most important speech about european securityand issued the most important pledgeof the post-cold war era .
anne applebaum in the washington post says president obama could make revitalisting nato his legacy .

at the same time , nato members should understand that any further enlargement is not charity work : every time the nato membership is extended to another state , current members have to be prepared to defend that state and if they are n't , then the enlargement should be stopped .
either article 5 is an absolute guarantee or it is worthless .
once nato has become clearer about its real security interests , its forces can again start carrying out annual exercises , annually , as they did during the cold war .
it 's time to rehearse our reaction to a crimean-style russian invasion of latvia , led not by regular troops but by little green men pretending to be local russians .
it 's time to anticipate , say , a civil war in libya or the fall of baghdad .
it 's time that nato had a better-coordinated cyberdefense and began to think more deeply about information warfare .

it 's also time to face the fact that russia may have already abandoned several post-cold war arms treaties , including those covering medium-range missiles : if that 's the case , we need to abandon them , too .
deterrence worked in the past , and it can work in the future all of these changes are possible .
obama might not have the power to make congress do what he wants , but he does have the power to relaunch the western alliance .

he has all of the cards the united states contributes three-quarters of nato 's budget as well as the ultimate argument : if the western alliance , as currently constituted , no longer wants to defend itself , america can always leave .
that might sharpen minds quickly enough to give obama a foreign policy legacy that would last .
jan techau at carnegie europe says nato is making is biggest strategic shift in 2 years .
the game changer is the readiness action plan ( rap ) , which will install a quasi-permanent nato troop presence on the alliance 's eastern flank .
the aim is to reassure members in central europe that nato 's article 5 security guaranteea pledge that an attack on one ally is an attack on allactually means something .
under the rap , the alliance will not station troops in the region but will rotate them in and out in an elaborate and tightly knit exercise-and-maneuver scheme .

allied troops will basically be on permanent increased patrol duty , reminding any potential aggressor ( primarily mr. putin ) that tampering with the borders of article 5 territory would be a bad idea .
in a last-minute move , the rap was widened to include nato 's southern flank .
this made it easier for allies like greece , spain , france , portugal , and italy to swallow the shift of attention to the east .
it also has the advantage of making the alliance look more serious about what is happening around the mediterranean .
nato can now claim that it is not entirely obsessed with russia alonean obsession that , diplomatically , is desirable for many allies .
at the summit now david cameron and anders fogh rasmussen , the nato secretary general , are posing for photographs one by one with leaders attending the summit .
if you are interested in the minutiae of summit choreography , it 's worth a watch .
here they are with the foreign minister of uzbekistan .
nato summit photocall
my colleague steve morris is in newport for the summit .
he says the police have even been providing transport to help the protesters .
steven morris ( @ stevenmorris20 ) nato summit - protestors gather at the cenotaph in newport to march on the venue .
steven morris ( @ stevenmorris20 ) very civilised feeling nato protest at the moment .
cops laying on courtesy buses to carry marchers back to city .

david cameron , barack obama , the german chancellor angela merkel , the french president francois hollande and the italian prime minister matteo renzi have been meeting the ukrainian president , petro poroshenko , at the summit this morning .
rt ( @ rt com ) # natosummituk # ukraine president poroshenko meets obama , merkel , cameron , hollande & renzi
earlier today david cameron ruled out arming ukraine .
( see 9.15am . )
according to some yougov polling figures out this morning , a plurality of voters are also opposed to the idea .
among the general public 39 % oppose providing large-scale military equipment to the government of ukraine , while 30 % are in support .
among those who are following the conflict closely , however , 49 % are in support and 37 % oppose .
the nato summit has clocked up its first arms sale .
( see 9.35am . )
but it 's not quite an al yamamah deal .
instead , the uk is selling some second-hand armoured vehicles to latvia .
here 's the press association story .
the uk has agreed to sell more than 100 surplus armoured vehicles to latvia in what is being billed as another step in bolstering the uk 's relations with its nato allies .

the ministry of defence said the sale of 123 surplus combat vehicle reconnaissance ( tracked ) ( cvr ( t ) ) armoured vehicles to the latvian army , in a package including their overhaul and refurbishment , is worth â£ 39.4 million .

the vehicles , which have seen action in bosnia and herzegovina , iraq and afghanistan , will help latvian armed forces to better transport soldiers , reconnaissance teams , air defence sections and mortar fire controllers as well as provide vital battlefield capabilities including ambulances , armoured command vehicles and armoured recovery vehicles , the mod said .

speaking at the nato summit today , defence secretary michael fallon said : i am delighted that latvia will soon benefit from these proven and life-saving battlefield capabilities , including ambulances and command centres .
this is just one way we are supporting our baltic nato allies .

as a leading member of nato the uk is keen to restate publicly our support for the collective security of its members and enable our partners to contribute to international peacekeeping and security operations .
the vehicles were identified as surplus to requirement after the 2010 strategic defence and security review ( sdsr ) .
they are being replaced by scout specialist vehicles , said to the army 's eyes and ears on the battlefields of the future .
anders fogh rasmussen , the nato secretary general , has also said time is running out for nato to sign a new agreement with afghanistan about its training mission in the country .
and here 's a response from giorgi margvelashvili , the president of georgia .
president of georgia ( @ margvelashvilig ) i thanked @ twitterid for his steadfast support for # georgia on its path to the # north atlantic integration .
# natosummituk @ twitterid

documents.title: nato to offer georgia a new cooperation package
text: georgia is not a member of nato , but it has a long-standing ambition to join .
according to anders fogh rasmussen , the nato secretary general , it is going to agree a cooperation package that is going to take it a step further towards becoming a member .
andersfogh rasmussen ( @ andersfoghr ) had a good meeting w/ @ twitterid .
at # natosummituk we 'll strengthen ties w/ # nato partners , incl # georgia .
our coop goes a long way andersfogh rasmussen ( @ andersfoghr ) tomorrow we 'll launch a new coop package to help strengthen # georgia 's defence , prepare for membership .

# natosummituk andersfogh rasmussen ( @ andersfoghr ) as one of the largest non- # nato troop contributor to # isaf in # afghanistan , # georgia demonstrated itself as a security exporter andersfogh rasmussen ( @ andersfoghr ) # georgia carried out remarkable democratic & defence reforms .
# nato urges georgia to continue w/ reforms , uphold rule of law
david cameron has been holding a bilateral meeting with president obama .
david cameron ( @ david cameron ) president @ twitterid and i have been discussing the situation in iraq/syria and ukraine at # natosummituk

documents.title: summit details
text: the uk government has a website page with details of the nato summit .
here 's a timetable for the summit .
and here 's a live feed , currently showing of the leaders arriving .
russia has warned nato not to offer membership to ukraine .
this is from reuters .

russia 's foreign minister warned nato not to offer ukraine membership of the alliance as it gathered for a summit on thursday and told the united states not to try to impose its will on the former soviet republic .

sergei lavrov also urged kiev and pro-russian rebels fighting ukrainian forces in eastern ukraine to back peace moves outlined by president vladimir putin and avert what he said could be a large-scale crisis in the heart of europe .
putin unveiled the seven-point plan on wednesday , the eve of a nato summit at which the crisis in ukraine will be discussed .

it is precisely at such a moment when a chance has emerged to start solving specific problems between kiev and the militias that some sections of the kiev authorities make demands for ukraine to drop its non-aligned status and start joining nato , lavrov said at talks with the organization for security and cooperation in europe , a rights and security group .
it 's a blatant attempt to derail all efforts aimed at initiating a dialogue on ensuring national reconciliation .
moscow has long said it will regard nato membership for ukraine as a national security threat .

underlining moscow 's concerns about u.s. influence on kiev , lavrov said : some of our western partners , including unfortunately the most influential players - the united states - want victory for nato and a situation where america dictates its will to everyone .
this concept of exclusivity , which president ( barack ) obama has repeatedly declared , can lead to no good and has so far led to no good , he said .
sergey lavrov , the russian foreign minister zemlianichenko/ap
according to the bbc , the afghan major who was supposed to be holding a flag at the opening ceremony for the nato summit has gone missing .
he 's applying for asylum .
here is another from the obama/cameron school visit .
u.s. embassy london ( @ usainuk ) not your average first week back ; mount pleasant primary welcomes two new students to class # natosummituk

documents.title: nato secretary general 's press conference - summary
text: anders fogh rasmussen , the nato secretary general news anders fogh rasmussen , the nato secretary general , gave a brief news conference a few minutes ago .
here are the main points .
rasmussen said nato would seriously consider any request from iraq to help it fight isis .
he also said nato would be willing to help train the iraqi armed forces again .
i do believe the international community as a whole has an obligation to stop the islamic state advancing further .
as regards nato , we have not received any request for a nato engagement .
i 'm sure that if the iraqi government were to forward a request for nato assistance , that would be considered seriously by nato allies .
let my remind you , nato has assisted iraq in the past .
we had a training mission in iraq until 2011 and if the iraqi government were to request the resumption of such training activities , i 'm sure nato allies would consider such a request seriously .
he gave a cautious welcome to the peace plan issued by president putin , but said that what mattered most in russia/ukraine was what happened on the ground .
describing it as a so-called peace plan , rasmussen said : what counts is what is actually happening on the ground .
we are still witnessing unfortunately russian involvement in de-stabilising the situation in eastern ukraine .

so we continue to call on russia to pull back its troops from the ukrainian borders , stop the flow of weapons and fighters into ukraine , stop the support for armed militants in ukraine and engage in a constructive political process .
that would be a genuine effort to facilitate a peaceful solution to the crisis in ukraine .

he said nato would be meeting the ukrainian president , petro poroshenko , today and that nato and ukraine would adopt a joint declaration , including concrete steps to enhance our partnership [ and ] step up cooperation between nato and ukraine .
he said that even though russia had violated the fundamental principles of the nato/russia founding act , he did not favour getting rid of it .
we have decided that while we have suspended all practical cooperation with russia , we will keep this political channel open .
the nato summit is not formally starting until about lunchtime .
first president obama is visiting a school in newport .
he is there with david cameron .
mike griffiths ( @ mrmikegriffiths ) video : cheering crowds greet president obama as he arrives at newport school # natosummituk
some from the nato summit .
air force one carrying president obama landing at raf fairford in gloucestershire yesterday .

giddens/pa scout specialist vehicle ( 2nd l ) and a foxhound armoured vehicle ( l ) and a full-size model aircraft displayed on the golf course of celtic manor hotel /reuters the conference is taking place at the celtic manor hotel outside newport .

the government wants to use the summit to showcase the uk defence and security industry ( david cameron never misses a chance to flog british arms ) and items of defence equipment are on display at the summit venue .
david cameron meeting anders fogh rasmussen , the nato secretary general , last night .

arrizabalaga/pa british army personnel patrol the celtic manor resort in newport arrizabalaga/epa a british police officer with a dog patrols alongside a security fence erected around the celtic manor resort super/ap

documents.title: david cameron 's morning interviews - summary
text: here are the main points from david cameron 's morning interviews .
i 've taken the quotes from politicshome and from the press association .

cameron said that he was personally supervising government attempts to see what can be done to help the briton held hostage by isis and that he always took charge of attempts to help british hostages .

whenever someone british is taken hostage anywhere in the world , the whole of the government comes together and i personally make sure this happens to hear from the agencies , the police , our security and intelligence agencies and everybody else to examine all the options about what can be done and also to make sure we do everything we can to look after their families .
he seemed to confirm that britain opens a line of communication with the isis hostage takers , although he stressed that the government was totally opposed to paying ransom .
i do n't want to go into the details of how we manage these events for reasons people would understand .
but obviously there 's a world of difference between communication and paying some ransom .
when today 's sarah montague said he seemed to be admitting that the government negotiates with isis , cameron said it would not be helpful to comment further .
( see 8.13am . )
he confirmed an attempt had been made to release the british hostage .
sadly , it failed , he said .
he confirmed that he was not ruling out britain taking part in air strikes against isis .
he suggested he would only order air strikes in response to an request from the iraqi government .
i 'm certainly not ruling anything out and i will always act in the british national interest .

what i would say , though , is this : i think it 's very important that western intervention is n't over the heads of those locally trying to fight this organisation and is n't done against the wishes and against the work of regional neighbours and partners .
i think that sometimes is the mistake that 's been made in the past .
he played down the idea of cooperating with syria 's president assad in the fight against isis .
my view is that president assad is part of the problem rather than part of the solution .
if you ask yourself : how come islamic state has managed to establish itself so quickly ?
part of the answer is assad 's brutality in syria gave credence to this group while the other opposition groups more democratic and pluralistic did n't , perhaps , get the support they needed .
he rejected the idea that air strikes against isis in syria would be illegal without assad 's approval .
( see 8.20am . )
he suggested britain could soon provide arms to the kurds .

britain has been helping to get arms to the kurds and we 're prepared to do and we 're considering actively whether to give them arms ourselves and also whether we can do more directly to train kurdish militia .
we 're already playing a role there , but we can do more .
he claimed sanctions against russia were working .
the russian economy was growing , it 's now shrinking ; russian banks are getting , some of them , short of money ; the russian stock market , the rouble , have suffered .
and what russia needs to understand is if they continue with this approach in ukraine , this pressure will be ramped up .
he ruled out supplying arms to ukraine .
we 're also giving them non-lethal equipment , things like body armour and other measures .
i do n't think we should be arming them directly ; i think we need a military de-escalation in ukraine rather than an escalation .
but they know , the ukrainians know , they have our support and this sanctions pressure is the right way to tell the russians that what they 're doing is unacceptable .
he said he would find scotland voting for independence heartbreaking .
it would break my heart if scotland leaves .
he ruled out resigning if scotland votes for independence .
david cameron ( @ david cameron ) i 'll be talking to @ twitterid4today about # natosummituk at 810am
the radio 5 live interview is now over .
it was cameron 's fifth this morning ( after itv , bbc breakfast , sky news , and today ) and his last .
i 'll post a summary of the highlights shortly .
q : what will stop putin ?
cameron says we need to show that russia needs the west more than the west needs russia .
q : is n't this like the lion in wizard of oz ?
cameron says he does not believe in an armed conflict .
look at what is happening in russia .
it 's economy is shrinking , the rouble is down , and the stock market is down .
q : at the end of the cold war we thought threats were over .
was it a mistake to cut the defence budget ?
cameron says he never thought threats had gone away .
britain has taken some difficult decisions on defence spending .
but that does not mean britain is not serious about defence .
the government has focused on having modern , deployable armed forces .
it is not just about having a large standing army .
it is important to have equipment you can use , he says .
as prime minister he has found the most useful parts of the military are transport planes , surveillance plans and special forces - assets you can deploy , he says .
q : what can be done to bring to justice the briton seen in the james foley/steven sotloff videos ?
cameron says the people who do this should know , one way or another , they will face justice .
he is sure that is true of this individual too .

documents.title: cameron 's radio 5 live interview
text: cameron is on radio 5 live now .
some of what he says duplicates what he said on today , and so i will leave out those answers .
i 'll try to focus just on the new material .
q : saudi arabia is providing funding to isis .
cameron says he does not agree .
q : so there 's no blame for saudi arabia ?
cameron says there are a lot of countries that britain deals whose direction it does not support .
but he does not see them as funding isis .
he thinks the saudis have done a lot recently to promote deradicalisation .
the daily mail 's political editor , james chapman , thinks david cameron is bluffing when he says he would not resign if scotland voted yes .
james chapman ( mail ) ( @ jameschappers ) cameron says again 'emphatically ' he would not resign if scotland votes to leave uk .
not sure i believe that # indyref the today interview is over .
but cameron is now being interviewed by nicky campbell on radio 5 live .
q : turning to scotland , what has gone wrong with the better together campaign ?
cameron says he does not think it has been negative of complacent .
as prime minister he is saying the rest of the uk wants scotland to stay .
he is not staying scotland can not be independent ; scotland , of course , can be independent .
but it is better off as part of the uk .
it 's an argument of the heart as well as the head , he says .
you can be a proud , patriotic scot , and also proud of being british .
q : so will you resign if scotland votes yes ?
cameron says he says no to that emphatically , because what is at stake is not his future as prime minister .
it 's scotland 's future .
q : the rest of the uk may feel hard done by .
cameron says he does not want to tie his future up with this vote .
q : so i can ask you after the vote .
cameron says montague can invite him on whenever she wants .
it would break my heart for scotland to leave , he says .
q : why are britons going abroad ?
cameron says he asks that question all the time .
a poisonous world view has arisen .
it is not representative if islam .
it 's a view that pops up all over the world wherever there is a broken state .
it is an extremist , poisonous , medievalist world view , he says .
q : your plans for a crackdown on british jihadists are virtually unworkable .
cameron says he does not accept that .
arrest people is the best option .
and arrests have risen sharply .
but the government needs other powers too .
he lists measures the government has already taken .
q : but taking passports off people is just not a runner ?
cameron says we do that today with dual nationals and naturalised britons .
he is now asking what can be done with british-born suspects .
he thinks there should be an option in the locker to prevent people coming back .
the government is looking at that .
david anderson , the independent reviewer of terrorist legislation , has suggested ways of improving tpims .
but cameron says he is not proposing an overhaul of terror legislation .
q : obama says he does not have a strategy .
cameron says he does not accept the idea there is not a strategy .
look at the many initiatives taken recently .
there is a crying need for a legitimate government in baghdad , he says .
q : would you sanction air strikes ?
cameron says he wo n't rule anything out .
but he says there is no doubt that isis ( which he calls isil ) provides a threat to people in europe .
the help britain gives must be in concert with those on the ground .
q : liam fox says air strikes would help .
these are all things that should be considered .
we have supported the american air strikes , cameron says .
q : so are you actively considering air strikes ?
cameron says he has not ruled anything out .
there is no simply , straightforward military-led answer to this , he says .
it needs to be a joined-up strategy , a tough , long-term , intelligent approach .
q : and does that involve an arrangement with president assad in syria ?
cameron says assad is part of the problem , not part of the solution .
assad 's brutality gave credence to this group .
the iraqi government , which was not seen as standing up for sunnis , also contributed to the problem .
q : but in syria the air force could hit back at the us and the uk ?
cameron says there has to be a long-term solution .
saying my enemy 's enemy is my friend has in the past led us into a quagmire .
there are complicated choices , he says .
but you have to understand that assad has been part of the creation of isis .
q : if iraq asks for air strikes , they become legal .
if assad asks for them , they become legal .
but if he does n't , air strikes in syria wo n't be legal .
cameron says assad has committed war crimes .
he suggests that air strikes in iraq or syria would not be too different .
britain would not act without legal backing , he says .
britain 's strategy must be fully joined up , he says .

documents.title: david cameron 's today interview
text: sarah montague is interviewing david cameron .
q : a briton is being held hostage in syria .
what can you do to help ?
it 's an absolutely tragic and difficult situtation , cameron says .
whenever any briton has been taken hostage , cameron says he has personally supervised government attempts to see what can be done to help .
he wo n't comment on the details .
but the government does everything it can .
there was an attempt at a hostage rescue some weeks ago .
sadly , it was n't successful , he says .
he says britain does not pay ransoms .
at the g8 he got other countries to sign up to this policy .
he says he is convinced paying ransoms leads to money going to terrorist groups .
q : is there any point communicating with these groups ?
cameron says he wo n't go into that .
but there is a difference between communication and paying ransom .
q ; communication suggests negotiation .
cameron says he wo n't get into that .
and cameron has been tweeting about the sunrise .
uk prime minister ( @ number10gov ) rt @ twitterid : stunning # sunrise over celtic manor in newport ahead of the start of # natosummituk this morning.¦
here 's my colleague patrick wintour 's twitter summary of what david cameron has already been saying in his morning interviews .
patrick wintour ( @ patrickwintour ) cameron am broadcasts .
talks of arming and training kurds .
is direct threat to uk .
assad part of the problem , not part of the solution .
david cameron is in newport in south wales this morning , where he will be hosting a two-day nato summit .

with islamic state ( isis , according to the guardian 's house style , but often referred to as isil by others ) now controlling a territory larger in size than the uk in syria and iraq , and russia launching a quasi-invasion of ukraine , this is one of the most important nato summits in recent years .
as patrick wintour reports in the guardian , cameron and president obama want to use the summit to build an anti-isis alliance .

barack obama and david cameron have vowed to use the nato summit starting in wales on thursday to engineer a resilient military and political coalition , including key countries in the middle east , capable of squeezing out and destroying islamic state ( isis ) in northern iraq .

british officials also said the britishprime minister was examining every option to protect the british hostage threatened by the jihadist group on tuesday , in light of its murder of the american journalists steven sotloff and james foley in the past month .
we will not be intimidated , obama said in estonia on the way to the summit .
their horrific acts only unite us and stiffen our resolve to take the fight against these terrorists .
and those who make the mistake of harming americans will learn that we will not forget and that our reach is long and that justice will be served .
cameron and obama have also set out their resolve to work together in an article in today 's times ( paywall ) .
here 's an extract .
those who want to adopt an isolationist approach misunderstand the nature of security in the 21st century .
developments in other parts of the world , particularly in iraq and syria , threaten our security at home .
and nato is not just an alliance of friends who come to the aid of each other in times of need .
it is also an alliance based on national self-interest .

whether it is regional aggression going unchecked or the prospect that foreign fighters could return from iraq and syria to pose a threat in our countries , the problems we face today threaten the security of british and american people , and the wider world .
our nations have always believed that we are more prosperous and secure when the world is more prosperous and secure .

so we have a real stake in making sure they grow up in a world where schoolgirls are not kidnapped , women are not raped in conflict and families are n't slaughtered because of their faith or political beliefs .
that is why we have decimated core al-qaeda and supported the afghan people .
and it is why we will not waver in our determination to confront isil .
if terrorists think we will weaken in the face of their threats they could not be more wrong .
countries like britain and america will not be cowed by barbaric killers .
we will be more forthright in the defence of our values , not least because a world of greater freedom is a fundamental part of how we keep our people safe .
today i will be focusing mostly on the nato summit , although i will up other political developments in my summaries , and perhaps elsewhere .
cameron has been giving interviews this morning and he is about to come on the today programme .
i will cover that live .
if you want to follow me on twitter , i 'm on @ twitterid .

bulletin.text: Cameron says UK could launch air strikes in Syria without Assad's approval.
